name: No-Name
effects: A No-Name weapon is 50% cheaper compared to its list price - this does not affect mods.

name: Akura Micro
effects: Reduce the AP required to attack by 1, but also decrease the base damage by 1. For Laser weapons, the base damage is decreased by 2 instead.

name: Azerra Firearms
effects: Add "Shredding (2)". If the weapon already has it, increase it by +1.

name: Callisto
effects: Attacks with a Callisto weapon gain a free trigger that can only be spent on the weapon's trigger options. The weapon cannot get any mods from the category "Mechanism", and it has one less mod slot.

name: Cerberus Armory
effects: The weapon has one less mod slot. When attacking with the weapon, you can decide if you want to make a regular attack or a non-lethal one. The non-lethal attack deals -2 damage but gains the "Incapacitating" and "Stunning" qualities.

name: Ekris Companions
effects: During each encounter, gain one edge point (so long as you actively use that weapon) that has to be spent during that encounter - or it is simply lost.

name: Exocore
effects: Functions without penalty or drawbacks in vacuum or low-G environments. Repairing or modding such a weapon is easier, reducing the target number by 1.

name: Forge Titan Dynamics
effects: Spend twice the ammo for each shot fired, but increase the base damage by +2.

name: Horizon Arms
effects: The first time such a weapon would suffer "Damaged" or jam during a scene, it can be ignored instead.

name: Lugtah Codex
effects: These weapons can fire 3D printed ammunition without the usual risks involved. Their energy-based weapons can simply be recharged using any power socket.

name: Nova Industries (Laser)
effects: Add "Penetrating (5)". If it already has it, increase it by +2 instead

name: Orion Tactical
effects: Gain +1 mod slot. For a single mod category of your choice, you may install up to two different mods instead.

name: Triton Systems
effects: Add "Concealed (3)". If it already has it, decrease it by 1 (to a min. of 1).

name: Vanguard Precision
effects: The weapon is automatically considered to have a "Marksman Scope"  installed, and you can switch between iron sights and the scope freely. This special scope is proprietary and cannot be taken off or replaced by a different scope. It does not occupy a mod slot though.
